intro: Tauschia nudicaulis, commonly known as the naked-stemmed tauschia, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb with slender, leafless stems that often lie close to the ground. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Its leaves are typically reduced to scale-like structures, giving it a distinctive appearance. Tauschia nudicaulis thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils.
